headline: Palantir’s Pentagon Cloud Win And New Deals Test Long Term Story
summary: Palantir Technologies (NasdaqGS:PLTR) received Pentagon authorization for its Federal Cloud Service Forward, widening use across defense environments including on-premises and edge deployments. The company renewed and expanded its multi-year partnership with Airbus for the Skywise aviation platform. Palantir announced a new collaboration with Cognizant to bring its AI tools into healthcare and broader enterprise workflows. Palantir enters this news cycle with its shares at $131.41 and a...

headline: Peter Thiel's Palantir Extends Partnership With Boeing Rival Airbus
summary: Software company Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR), co-founded by Peter Thiel, has announced the expansion of its partnership with aircraft manufacturer Airbus SE (OTC:EADSY) (OTC:EADSF). Multi-Year Agreement In an official press release published on Tuesday, the companies announced the extension of their collaboration after signing a multi-year agreement on the open data platform Skywise, developed jointly by the two companies. headline: Palantir is off to Miami, while oil prices fall on Iran talks
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Tuesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has reopened negotiations with Paramount Skydance (PSKY). Paramount has one week to make its final offer. Netflix (NFLX) currently has a pending deal with Warner Bros. Palantir (PLTR) is moving its headquarters from Denver to Miami. Oil (CL=F, BZ=F) prices are falling as the US and Iran make progress on nuclear negotiations. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Palantir is off to Miami, while oil prices fall on Iran talks
content.description:
Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Tuesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute.

Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has reopened negotiations with Paramount Skydance (PSKY). Paramount has one week to make its final offer. Netflix (NFLX) currently has a pending deal with Warner Bros.

Palantir (PLTR) is moving its headquarters from Denver to Miami.

Oil (CL=F, BZ=F) prices are falling as the US and Iran make progress on nuclear negotiations.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
content.summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Tuesday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has reopened negotiations with Paramount Skydance (PSKY). Paramount has one week to make its final offer. Netflix (NFLX) currently has a pending deal with Warner Bros. Palantir (PLTR) is moving its headquarters from Denver to Miami. Oil (CL=F, BZ=F) prices are falling as the US and Iran make progress on nuclear negotiations. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Palantir Is Latest Tech Firm to Move Headquarters to Miami
summary: Miami has been attracting firms and wealthy business executives since the outset of the pandemic drawn by a mix of low taxes, good weather and relatively safe streets.  Since Citadel’s big move in 2022, finance companies and tech companies such as Apple Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. have opened or expanded offices.  ServiceNow Inc. has committed to opening an office in West Palm Beach.

content.title: Palantir Is Latest Tech Firm to Move Headquarters to Miami
content.summary: Miami has been attracting firms and wealthy business executives since the outset of the pandemic drawn by a mix of low taxes, good weather and relatively safe streets.  Since Citadel’s big move in 2022, finance companies and tech companies such as Apple Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. have opened or expanded offices.  ServiceNow Inc. has committed to opening an office in West Palm Beach.

headline: Does Palantir Technologies (PLTR) Still Justify Its Valuation After Recent Share Price Swings?
summary: If you are wondering whether Palantir Technologies at US$131.41 is priced for perfection or still has room to run, you are asking the right question and valuation is where that answer starts. The stock has recently been volatile, with a 5.8% decline over the last 7 days, a 23.1% decline over 30 days and a 21.7% decline year to date, although the 1 year return is 5.4% and the 3 year return is very large. Recent headlines have continued to focus on Palantir's role in software for government...

headline: Palantir Shifts Headquarters to Miami From Denver After Protests
summary: The announcement was made Tuesday in a brief statement on the social media platform X, with no reason provided for the move.  “We’re very excited as a company and anxious to be a part of the community here,” Shon Manasco, a Palantir executive, said while speaking on a panel at the Defense Tech Leadership Summit on Tuesday in West Palm Beach.

content.title: Palantir Shifts Headquarters to Miami From Denver After Protests
content.summary: The announcement was made Tuesday in a brief statement on the social media platform X, with no reason provided for the move.  “We’re very excited as a company and anxious to be a part of the community here,” Shon Manasco, a Palantir executive, said while speaking on a panel at the Defense Tech Leadership Summit on Tuesday in West Palm Beach.
